c74object.name: dada.bounce
c74object.description: Implements a geometrical bouncing chamber for balls traveling at constant speed. Each edge hit triggers musical data.

outlet.digest: bang when object is changed via the interface

method.name: (drag)
method.digest: Load file or set background image
method.description: Dragging an llll or text file on the object will load its content, if a proper readable format is recognized. If the file is an image, it will be loaded as object background (whenever meaningful)

method.name: (keyboard)
method.description:
• Esc: reset center to (0, 0) and zoom to 100%
• Tab: autozoom
• Cmd+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Z (win): perform undo step
• Cmd+Shift+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Y (win): perform redo step
• Spacebar: toggle play

method.name: (mouse)
method.description:
• mousewheel scroll: move the visible region
• Cmd+mousewheel scroll (mac) or Ctrl+mousewheel scroll (win): change zoom
• right-click or two-fingers tap: open contextual menu for basic operations
• click+drag on an element ot move it
↪ Add the Alt key to duplicate it
• Cmd+click (mac) or Ctrl+click (win) on to delete it
• right click or two fingers tap: open contextual menu

method.name: (tools)
method.description:
Tools are combination of a specific key pressed and some mouse action. Whenever you press the key, if the tool is available, the mouse cursor will switch to the tool specific one.
Available tools are:
• Keep the Z key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to change the zoom
• Keep the X key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to move the displayed center
• Keep the N key pressed, click on the desired element and drag up or down in order to modify its pitch.
• Keep the V key pressed, click on the desired element and drag up or down in order to modify its velocity.
• Keep the S key pressed, click on the desired element and drag up or down in order to scale its magnitude or value.
• Keep the R key pressed, click on the desired element and drag up or down in order to rotate it.
• Keep the Q key pressed, click on an element, drag up or down to modify the color hue or saturation.
• Keep the L key pressed, click on an element, keep the mouse down and release the mouse on another element to connect the two elements.

method.name: addball
method.description: Adds a new ball in the room. The correct syntax is: addball BALL_SYNTAX, where the ball syntax is the one documented in the dump message. The ball syntax should NOT be wrapped in parenthesis. For instance, a valid message is: addball [coord -90. 20.] [speed 100. 30.] [color 0.4 0. 0. 1.] After the ball has been added, a notification is sent through the second outlet in the form addball ball_index.

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs a single step of movement.

method.name: clear
method.description: The word clear force all elements to be deleted. A first argument limits the elements to be dumped. The clear room message only clears the room state; the clear balls message only clears the balls state.

method.name: clock
method.description: The word clock, followed by the name of an existing setclock objects, sets the dada.bounce object to be controlled by that setclock object rather than by Max's internal millisecond clock. The word clock by itself sets the object back to using Max's regular millisecond clock.

method.name: deleteball
method.description: Deletes the N-th ball, where N is the specified index argument.

method.name: domain
method.description: The domain message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the X axis. The domain message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the left boundary or at the right boundary of the object box.

method.name: dump
method.description:
Outputs the current state of the object. The syntax is bounce [room GRAPH] [balls BALL1 BALL2...]. each ball is in the syntax (coord x y) (speed x y) (color r g b a) (channel MIDIchannel) (flags flags).
A first argument limits the elements to be dumped. The dump room message only dumps the room state; the dump balls message only dumps the balls state.
Graph syntax in dada is the following one [VERTEX1 VERTEX2...] [EDGE1 EDGE2...]. Each vertex is an llll shaped as [[coord x y] METADATA1 METADATA2...]. Each edge is an llll shaped as [edge_start_vertex_index edge_end_vertex_index METADATA1 METADATA2...], where the indices of the vertices are 1-based, and correspond to the position on the vertices in the corresponding vertices llll. The METADATA llll may depend on the graph metadata type. For instance, if the edges or vertices contain information about pitch and velocity, they might be something like [pitch midicents_value] and/or [velocity velocity_value].
Item flags syntax in dada is the following one [flags flag1 flag2...], where each flag is one of the following symbols: lock, mute, solo, inactive.

method.name: exportimage
flush
method.description: The word flush force all the note-offs for notes being played to be sent. This is effective only when the play attribute is set to 1.

method.name: getdomain
method.description: The getdomain message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the X axis, preceded by a domain symbol.

method.name: getrange
method.description: The getrange message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the Y axis, preceded by a range symbol.

method.name: int
method.description: A non-zero integer triggers a play message, a zero integer triggers a stop message

method.name: llll
method.description: Sets the current state of the object. The syntax must follow the one described in the dump message documentation (although room only or balls only can be assigned).

method.name: meta
method.description:
Examples:
• meta edge 5 [pitch 6300] [vel 80] → Assign a pitch of 6300 cents and a velocity of 80 as metadata for 5th edge
• meta vertex 4 [pitch 6300] [vel 80] → The same, for 4th vertex
• meta edge 1 [score roll [[200 [7200. 405. 100]] [700 [6300. 405. 100]]]] → Assign a bach.roll syntax as score metadata for edge 1
• meta edge 1 [score score [[[[ 4 4 ] [[ 1/4 120 ]]] [ 1 [ 4700. 100 0 ]]]]] → Assign a bach.score syntax as score metadata for edge 1
The word meta, followed by the edge symbol or the vertex symbol, and the edge or vertex index, assigns metadata to a vertex or an edge. The metadata should be contained in the llll specified as further argument. If the metadata type is set to "Pitch and velocity", such llll should contain a specification such as [pitch mc] and/or [velocity vel]. If the metadata type is set to "Scores", such llll should be the score itself.

method.name: move
method.description:
Examples:
• move component 1 [10 10] → Move the 1st connected component by (10, 10)
• move vertex 5 [-4 0] → Move the 5th vertex by (-4, 0)
• move edge 3 [0 10] → Shift 2nd edge up by 10
• move ball 1 [0 10] → Shift 1st ball up by 10
The word move followed by an element type (either vertex or edge or component or ball), followed by the index of a shape or ball and a vector in wrapped [x y] syntax, translates the element by the given vector.

method.name: notes
method.description: When type is set to "Pitch and Velocity", the notes message assigns a pitch and velocity to each of the edges. An llll of type [pitch vel] [pitch vel]... is expected as argument.

method.name: play
method.description: Starts the sequencing engine.

method.name: range
method.description: The range message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the Y axis The range message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the bottom boundary or at top right boundary of the object box.

method.name: read
method.description: The specified file is read from disk and the llll it contains loaded as current state. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: rotate
method.description:
Examples:
• rotate component 1 2 → Rotate the 1st connected component by 2 radians
• rotate ball 1 [30 deg] → Rotate the 1st ball by 30 degrees
The word rotate followed by an element type (either component or ball), followed by the index of a shape and an angle in radians rotates the element by the given angle. If the angle is terminates with the degrees ° symbol after the number (without any spaces) or if it is given as an llll of the form [angle deg], then the angle is assumed to be in degrees.

method.name: scale
method.description:
Examples:
• scale ball 3 4 → Scale 3rd ball velocity by 4
• scale component 1 0.5 → Shrink 1st connected component by 2
The word scale followed by an element type (either component or ball), followed by the index of a shape and a floating point number, scales the element by the given number.

method.name: scores
method.description: When type is set to "Scores", the scores message assigns a score to each of the edges. An llll of type [SCORE1] [SCORE2]... is expected as argument, where each SCORE is usually a bach.roll or bach.score gathered syntax, but can also be any other llll.

method.name: split
method.description:
Example: split edge 3 [-40 0] → Split 3rd edge by adding a point at (-40, 0)
The word split followed by the edge symbol, by the index of the edge to be split, and by the wrapped llll with the splitting [x y] coordinates, splits the given edge at the specified point, and outputs a notification through the second outlet containing the edge split symbols, plus the sequence of newly created edges.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops the sequencing engine.

method.name: subdivide
method.description:
Example: subdivide edge 5 4 → Subdivide 5th edge into 4 parts
The word subdivide followed by the edge symbol, by the index of the edge to be subdivide, and by an integer number, subdivides the given edge into the specified number of new segments, and outputs a notification through the second outlet containing the edge subdivide symbols, plus the sequence of newly created edges.

method.name: write
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in native format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: writetxt
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in a human-readable text format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

attribute.name: allowcentershift
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to allow the center to shift.

attribute.name: allowzoom
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to allow zooming

attribute.name: axescolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the x and y axes.

attribute.name: axeslabelscolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the x and y axes labels.

attribute.name: axeslabelsfontsize
attribute.description: Sets the size of the axes labels font.

attribute.name: ballsize
attribute.description: s Sets the size of each ball.

attribute.name: bgcolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the background.

attribute.name: bgimage
attribute.description: Sets a background image texture, tiling the plane. Use "" or "none" to remove the image.

attribute.name: blinktime
attribute.description: Sets the blinking time of the played edges in milliseconds

attribute.name: bordercolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the border.

attribute.name: bouncedata
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to output bounce information from third outlet.

attribute.name: center
attribute.description: Sets the coordinate of the center

attribute.name: edgewidth
attribute.description: s Sets the edge width.

attribute.name: embed
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to embed the state of the object within the patcher.

attribute.name: gridcolor
attribute.description: Sets the grid color.

attribute.name: gridlabelscolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the grid labels.

attribute.name: gridlabelsfontsize
attribute.description: Sets the size of the grid labels font.

attribute.name: gridmode
attribute.description: Sets the grid mode, either Fixed (0) or Automatic (1 = default). In Automatic mode the space between grid lines is automatically adapted according to the level of zoom.

attribute.name: gridstep
attribute.description: Sets the grid size, in coordinates (only useful if gridmode is set to 0 = Fixed)

attribute.name: indexaschannel
attribute.description: If active, the output MIDI channel is NOT the ball midichannel, rather the ball index.

attribute.name: maxundosteps
attribute.description: Sets the maximum number of undo steps (0 being: no undo).

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: Sets the graph metadata mode: either edges have pitch and velocity information (0), or vertices do (1). In this case, when a ball hits an edge, the resulting pitch/velocity will be the appropriate interpolation of the vertices' pitches.

attribute.name: mousehover
attribute.description: Toggles mouse hovering capabilities.

attribute.name: noteoff
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the noteoff information for a previous edge, once a ball hits a new one.

attribute.name: notifypaint
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to notify every new redraw of the box via a "painted" symbol.

attribute.name: playcolor
attribute.description: Sets the playing color.

attribute.name: playstep
attribute.description: Sets the play step interval in milliseconds.

attribute.name: roomcolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the graph constituting the room.

attribute.name: showaxes
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the x and y axes.

attribute.name: showaxeslabels
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the x and y axes labels.

attribute.name: showballs
attribute.description: s Toggles the ability to display the balls.

attribute.name: showborder
attribute.description: Sets the color of the border.

attribute.name: showfocus
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to draw a thicker border when the object has the focus.

attribute.name: showgrid
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the grid.

attribute.name: showgridlabels
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the grid labels.

attribute.name: showroom
attribute.description: s Toggles the ability to show the room graph.

attribute.name: showspeed
attribute.description: s Toggles the ability to display the ball speed.

attribute.name: snaptogrid
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to snap items to the grid.

attribute.name: speeddisplayfactor
attribute.description: s Sets the display factor for the ball speed.

attribute.name: speedvel
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to rescale velocities depending on the normal component of the speed of the ball bouncing on an edge.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Sets the graph metadata type: either a combination of pitch and velocity (simple case) or a complex score.

attribute.name: undobeforeplay
attribute.digest: Save State For Undo Before Playing
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to save the state for an undo step before playing

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Save State For Undo Before Playing

attribute.name: verboseundo
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to post undo/redo steps in the Max window.

attribute.name: vertexsize
attribute.description: s Sets the size of each vertex.

attribute.name: xlabel
attribute.description: Sets the label for the x axis.

attribute.name: ylabel
attribute.description: Sets the label for the y axis.

entry.name: Outlet 5 (bang)
entry.description: bang when object is changed via the interface.
